messages.messageBody:
Congratulations and welcome Alexander!
Mary-NY

>course
> >Alex hates that, too bad.
>

>and he's Alex. So in that circle ours has already been dubbed Lexi.

>One of the reasons I love the name is all the cool nicknames, Xander
>included.
>
>Kelly

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Names was congratulations Kelly
messages.msgSnippet: ... I ve got a friend with an Alexander who is the same age as my middle boy, and he s Alex.  So in that circle ours has already been dubbed Lexi. One of the
messages.messageBody:
>The coolest nickname for Alexander, is Xander, like on Buffy, but of course
>Alex hates that, too bad.

I've got a friend with an Alexander who is the same age as my middle boy,
and he's Alex. So in that circle ours has already been dubbed Lexi.

One of the reasons I love the name is all the cool nicknames, Xander
included.

Kelly

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Names was congratulations Kelly
messages.msgSnippet: ... I saw that, another Alexander!  I wanted Zachary Alexander, but my dh said no dice to that, said it was too wierd ? ...*sigh*  So he is Alexander Andres.
messages.messageBody:
SandraDodd@... writes:
> starsuncloud@... writes:
>
> <<I love the name too. I tried to name my second ds Alexander, but dh didn't
>
> go for it...he's Jared Alexander instead. >>
>
> Goo, Kelly! An unschooler who will need no deschooling!
>
>
> Marty Dodd's name is
> Martin Alexander Dodd


I saw that, another Alexander! I wanted Zachary Alexander, but my dh said no
dice to that, said it was too wierd ? ...*sigh* So he is Alexander Andres.
Like that's not wierd.lol But it's my husband's middle name ....

The coolest nickname for Alexander, is Xander, like on Buffy, but of course
Alex hates that, too bad.

~Aimee
